response_parsed.title: Deploying Cron-Driven Tasks Using FastAPI in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide will walk you through the process of setting up and deploying cron-driven tasks using FastAPI, a modern web framework for building APIs with Python 3.12+.
key_points: Create the main FastAPI application file
Define and register the cron job
Set up the Cron daemon to run the script

code_examples.code:
crontab -e
# Add the following line to schedule your script:
0 * * * * * /path/to/your/script.py

version_notes: Ensure you are using Python 3.12+ for this method.
Upgrade to the latest versions of FastAPI, uvicorn, and aiocron if available.
caveats: Keep in mind that the cron daemon will run the script as a separate process from your main application.
Be aware that cron jobs can only execute tasks at specific intervals and not real-time events.
